message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of breaking down botnets, which is a major concern in the field of computer security (cs.CR). The proposed method involves estimating the probability of connections between bots in a P2P network, which requires knowledge of network models and end-to-end delay distribution (cs.NI). The method also involves using probabilistic techniques to reconstruct the topology of the C&C channel, which is a problem in graph theory (cs.DS). The authors use simulations to evaluate the effectiveness of their method, which involves collecting data and using statistical techniques to estimate network parameters, which is a common approach in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of P2P botnets, which is a topic in the field of social informatics (cs.SI).
